title: How to Make Havarti Cheese

steps.headline: Heat all of the milk to 86° F, or 30° C, and add mesophilic culture (which you can buy at your nearest cheese-making suppliers.)
steps.description: Let the milk sit for 45 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the calf rennet to the milk mixture, stir for one minute.
By this point you should have curds.
steps.description: Check the curds for firmness. If they are firm, start cutting them at half-inch intervals to drain whey. Sit the curds out for a few minutes, then add the curds and stir for 15 minutes. If the curds are not firm, cook until they are firm and then do the listed steps above.

steps.headline: Boil a gallon of water to 130° F, or about 54° C, then set aside.
Drain approximately 1/3 of the whey and stir for an additional 15 minutes.
steps.description: Add the gallon of water you just boiled, and test the mixture. In the end, the mixture should be in the range of 95-100° F, or 35-37°C.

steps.headline: Add 2 tablespoons of salt and stir until the curds separate and appear dried.
Transfer the mixture to a cloth lined strainer and drain all of the whey!
steps.description: You can also slice the curds to release more whey.

steps.headline: Now transfer to a cloth lined mold.
steps.description: The mold can be any shape you want. Add an 8-pound weight (or something else that is 8 pounds) onto the cheese. Leave the weight tot 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Unwrap and re-wrap the cheese, turn it over, and add 16 pounds for 2 hours.
Check on the cheese after the 2 hours.
steps.description: By now the cheese should be firm. Leave on the counter without any weight on it for 2 hours. After 2 hours, submerge in water 65° F, or about 18° C for 8 hours.

steps.headline: After the Havarti cheese has been in the water for 8 hours, sink it in brine (1 tablespoon salt to 1 quart of water) for 6 hours, then drain and dry the surface with paper towels, or if you're going green, with a cloth until clean.
Keep the cheese unwrapped in a room 60° F, 15° C, and turn daily.
steps.description: Wipe with the brine using the proportions above every two days.

steps.headline: In about 3 months, or until you are satisfied with the ripeness, your cheese will be ready!
steps.description: Wrap and store in the refrigerator until you are ready to use it.

text: Heat all of the milk to 86° F, or 30° C, and add mesophilic culture (which you can buy at your nearest cheese-making suppliers.) Let the milk sit for 45 minutes. Add the calf rennet to the milk mixture, stir for one minute. Let rest for 35 minutes. By this point you should have curds. Check the curds for firmness. If they are firm, start cutting them at half-inch intervals to drain whey. Sit the curds out for a few minutes, then add the curds and stir for 15 minutes. If the curds are not firm, cook until they are firm and then do the listed steps above. Boil a gallon of water to 130° F, or about 54° C, then set aside.  Drain approximately 1/3 of the whey and stir for an additional 15 minutes. Add the gallon of water you just boiled, and test the mixture. In the end, the mixture should be in the range of 95-100° F, or 35-37°C. Add 2 tablespoons of salt and stir until the curds separate and appear dried.  Transfer the mixture to a cloth lined strainer and drain all of the whey! You can also slice the curds to release more whey. Now transfer to a cloth lined mold. The mold can be any shape you want. Add an 8-pound weight (or something else that is 8 pounds) onto the cheese. Leave the weight tot 20 minutes. Unwrap and re-wrap the cheese, turn it over, and add 16 pounds for 2 hours.  Check on the cheese after the 2 hours. By now the cheese should be firm. Leave on the counter without any weight on it for 2 hours. After 2 hours, submerge in water 65° F, or about 18° C for 8 hours. After the Havarti cheese has been in the water for 8 hours, sink it in brine (1 tablespoon salt to 1 quart of water) for 6 hours, then drain and dry the surface with paper towels, or if you're going green, with a cloth until clean.  Keep the cheese unwrapped in a room 60° F, 15° C, and turn daily. Wipe with the brine using the proportions above every two days. In about 3 months, or until you are satisfied with the ripeness, your cheese will be ready! Wrap and store in the refrigerator until you are ready to use it.
